cleaned.title: [BIP-488] Authorize Mimic Smart Vaults on Mainnet, Avalanche, and Base
cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-488] Authorize Mimic Smart Vaults on Mainnet, Avalanche, and Base
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/631

### Motivation

The core purpose of the proposal is to take the manual labor of handling protocol fees out of the hands of the Balancer Maxis and automate the process to make the DAO as streamlined and sustainable as possible. Protocol fees are accruing on all networks at a healthy rate and Mimic is at the point where they are capable of managing this process in an automated way. One can review [BIP-294](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-294-authorize-mimic-smart-vault-on-arbitrum/4779) which authorized Mimic on Arbitrum for more information on the particulars, as well as [BIP-115](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-115-balancer-smart-vaults-fee-collector/3966) for the original development plan. This proposal will authorize Mimic vaults on Mainnet, Avalanche, and Base to execute the same automation. These vaults are using Mimic v3, as opposed to v2 like the prior instances. Addresses can be confirmed [here](https://www.notion.so/mimic-fi/Balancer-Fee-Collector-v3-Test-Base-Avalanche-and-Mainnet-instructions-89bda03acb7b4cf09b2bb2794eb0fa31?pvs=4#89b9190d21c240409f6eabca86c8778c). 

### Specification

#### Mainnet

The DAO Multisig on Ethereum `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call grantRole with the following arguments:

role: `0x826ac7ce861f2a54e071e6c724653757fdd1259804eb1ca7f040aa1cd09923fe`

which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Ethereum, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/046a1e24803a48ce02196de3474066bda26d3bb6/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L534).

account: `0x9e5D6427D2cdaDC68870197b099C2Df535Ec3c97`

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on [Ethereum](https://etherscan.io/address/0x9e5d6427d2cdadc68870197b099c2df535ec3c97#code).

#### Avalanche
The DAO Multisig on Avalanche `0x17b11FF13e2d7bAb2648182dFD1f1cfa0E4C7cf3` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call grantRole with the following arguments:

role: `0x9b7cac7a6e50200d3ceb1372c25ac2f697fa4ba4495fb37091ffc35e5b4f8a42`

which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Avalanche, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/046a1e24803a48ce02196de3474066bda26d3bb6/action-ids/avalanche/action-ids.json#L83).

account: 0x9e5D6427D2cdaDC68870197b099C2Df535Ec3c97

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on [Avalanche](https://snowtrace.io/address/0x9e5d6427d2cdadc68870197b099c2df535ec3c97).

 #### Base
The DAO Multisig on Base `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` and call grantRole with the following arguments:

role: `0xe4041b7c17d9c1871f2ba2855b724e8cdbb7c190bc2fbfaab37f914aa5ead4e9`

which corresponds to the role for calling withdrawCollectedFees on the ProtocolFeeWithdrawer on Base, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/046a1e24803a48ce02196de3474066bda26d3bb6/action-ids/base/action-ids.json#L142C64-L142C130).

account: `0x9e5D6427D2cdaDC68870197b099C2Df535Ec3c97`

which is the contract address for the Mimic smart vault on [Base](https://basescan.org/address/0x9e5d6427d2cdadc68870197b099c2df535ec3c97).

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-551] Claim and Relock Balancer DAO’s AURA / vlAURA
cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-551] Claim and Relock Balancer DAO’s AURA / vlAURA
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/819

## Summary

The Balancer DAO has locked its vested AURA into vlAURA with [[BIP-481]](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-481-claim-and-lock-balancer-dao-aura-allocation-into-vlaura/5319). The first lock of 1.42m AURA will expire and can be relocked after March 7th and before the unlolck date of March 14th, 2024:

 
![bip-551.png](ipfs://bafkreigqscbntq3fhxjxnaicwwfro3tn7zzntkhpp4ecec25bd7c5z3bfi)
    

The DAO wishes to relock its current position and bundle it with an additional vest so the next unlock is bundled into one in 16 weeks from the relock date.

## Motivation

The Balancer DAO wishes to relock its vlAURA position to continue to vote for Balancer gauges with its position. To do so the DAO needs to relock its expired position timely after March 7th and before March 14th 2024

At the time of writing, the DAO is entitled again to roughly ~280k AURA tokens (can be verified by calling `available` with `_recipient` as `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` https://etherscan.io/address/0xfd72170339ac6d7bdda09d1eaca346b21a30d422 ). Another ~297k AURA remains unvested and will be claimed at a later date.

We are proposing to initiate another lock with the available ~280k AURA to be used to vote on AURA governance. The specifics of the Balancer DAOs voting allocations can be found [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-508-utilize-locked-aura-to-support-ecosystem-growth/5419).

By re-locking the initial position and vesting additional AURA between March 7th and March 14th which would fall into the same locking epoch, it is guaranteed that the entirety of the locks will be up for re-lock in 16 weeks, reducing load on the multi-sig, streamlining the management of this position.

## Specification

The Balancer DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the vlAURA contract at `0x3fa73f1e5d8a792c80f426fc8f84fbf7ce9bbcac` and call `processExpiredLocks` with argument `true` - The execution needs to be timed AFTER March 7th and BEFORE March 14th

Additionally, the DAO multisig on mainnet `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will call the `claim` function on the AuraVestedEscrow at `0xfd72170339ac6d7bdda09d1eaca346b21a30d422` with the parameter `_lock` set to `true`. This execution, as well as the above, needs to be timed AFTER March 7th and BEFORE March 14th

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-276] Enable new L2 gauges
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### [PR with Payload](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/162)

### Motivation

Balancer contributors recently completed development on new non-ethereum ("L2") gauges which feature the ability to have cross chain reward boosts via Layer Zero. In order for these new gauges to function properly each child chain factory on L2 must be added to the pseudo minter on that network. If this is not done then BAL emissions cannot flow through the new gauges.


### Specification


### Arbitrum
#1
The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x57f5e3be3930b0a9235265a5237eb44d5ec61fe36999757360b72280c4dcd991`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#L593).

account: `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the pseudo minter `0xc3ccacE87f6d3A81724075ADcb5ddd85a8A1bB68` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0x6817149cb753BF529565B4D023d7507eD2ff4Bc0`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/arbitrum.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x57f5e3be3930b0a9235265a5237eb44d5ec61fe36999757360b72280c4dcd991`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#L593).

account: `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.


### Polygon
#1
The DAO Multisig on Polygon `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x71b144ace6b2cd2762fedff00a9e45c9b7b742ee590f9d593c61e48b6c9ad790`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/polygon/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Polygon `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the pseudo minter `0x47B489bf5836f83ABD928C316F8e39bC0587B020` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0x22625eEDd92c81a219A83e1dc48f88d54786B017`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/polygon.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Polygon `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x71b144ace6b2cd2762fedff00a9e45c9b7b742ee590f9d593c61e48b6c9ad790`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/polygon/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.


### Gnosis
#1
The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xff178bcb549aae01d4613b3ca6c16f1fa42e808cd1bddd210756b3878cfa9268`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/gnosis/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the pseudo minter `0xA8920455934Da4D853faac1f94Fe7bEf72943eF1` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0x83E443EF4f9963C77bd860f94500075556668cb8`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/gnosis.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Gnosis `gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0xff178bcb549aae01d4613b3ca6c16f1fa42e808cd1bddd210756b3878cfa9268`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/gnosis/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.


### Optimism
#1
The DAO Multisig on Optimism `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x212ccfca4a02e0eff2a0a5029495a2697d4efa7a8e95cdbf30e2f38c40ca648f`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/optimism/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This allows the DAO Multisig to call `addGaugeFactory` on the pseudo minter.

#2
The DAO Multisig on Optimism `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the pseudo minter `0x4fb47126Fa83A8734991E41B942Ac29A3266C968` calling `addGaugeFactory` with the following argument:

factory: `0xa523f47A933D5020b23629dDf689695AA94612Dc`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/tasks/20230316-child-chain-gauge-factory-v2/output/optimism.json).

This adds the child chain factory to the pseudo minter.

#3
The DAO Multisig on Optimism `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x212ccfca4a02e0eff2a0a5029495a2697d4efa7a8e95cdbf30e2f38c40ca648f`

can be confirmed [here ](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/98e3d8c9be5a175f599c4e95d3ed3757bbc4e307/pkg/deployments/action-ids/optimism/action-ids.json#L646).

account: `0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc`

which corresponds to the address for the DAO Multisig. This removes the role added above.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-419] Kill Duplicate BRZ/jBRL Gauge [Polygon]
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/495

#### Summary
BRZ/jBRL has recently moved to a new pool and gauge. The current pool utilized can be seen [here](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0x42942cdec85078cf0e28e9cb5acd40cb53997ed6000000000000000000000bea). The duplicate pool, which is not utilized can be seen [here](https://0xe19ed40a47f9b0cea4ca6d372df66107758913ec000000000000000000000b41). There is no need to have a gauge for both pools active on the gauge controller, therefore I am proposing to kill the gauge which serves no purpose.

Pool address: [0xe19ed40A47F9B0CEA4ca6D372dF66107758913Ec](https://app.balancer.fi/#/polygon/pool/0xe19ed40a47f9b0cea4ca6d372df66107758913ec000000000000000000000b41)
Gauge address: [0x455f20c54b5712a84454468c7831f7c431aeeb1c](https://etherscan.io/address/0x455f20c54b5712a84454468c7831f7c431aeEB1C#readContract)

#### Specification:

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call performAction using `0xab8f0945` for the `data(bytes)` argument and the gauge address `0x455f20c54b5712a84454468c7831f7c431aeeb1c` will be used for the `target(address)` argument.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-485] Kill R Gauges
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
### PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/629

# Summary

The R stablecoin has recently experienced an [exploit](https://twitter.com/raft_fi/status/1723317254480425028) where R was continuously minted and exchanged across liquidity sources. The exploiter still has excess R tokens, which can be swapped for liquidity, making it irresponsible to incentivize liquidity for the token. R pools were not included in the most recent core pool bribe. Due to the instability of the token, and Raft's intention to sunset the current version of the protocol, it is not necessary to incentivize liquidity for these pools any further. 

# Motivation

Due to Raft sunsetting the current version of the protocol the R token should no longer be supported by BAL emissions. 

# Specifications

The DAO Multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptorEntrypoint at `0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA` and call performAction using `0xab8f0945` for the `data(bytes)` argument and use each gauge address as the `target(address)`

R/DAI - `0x6f3b31296fd2457eba6dca3bed65ec79e06c1295`

R/sDAI - `0x3b861b81b086ef0cffa0b00cd2ddb3d545ec9b98`

R/wstETH - `0x6e7b9a1746a7ed4b23edff0975b726e5aa673e21`

Core pool status has already been removed for these pools, per discussion between the Maxis and the Raft team.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: This proposal aims to update the Fantom multisig responsible for claiming vested BEETS tokens and consolidate multisig control to the Balancer Maxi multisig on Fantom, improving multisig management and security for the DAO's vested assets. The vote timeline shows unanimous early and stable support for the 'Yes' option. Forum discussion reveals some initial concerns but overall acceptance, with no significant opposition. Historical similar proposals also passed with strong support and did not lead to negative market or TVL impact.
key_arguments_for: Unanimous voting support across all quartiles for 'Yes, let's do it' indicates strong consensus.
Proposal consolidates multisig control to an active, trusted Maxi multisig, reducing risk from inactive Fantom multisig.
Forum comments confirm the goal is operational efficiency and security without immediate token usage plans.
Similar past proposals with analogous operational changes had successful outcomes without negative token price or TVL impact.
key_arguments_against: Some forum comments expressed initial caution about bridging or managing funds, suggesting the need for clear multisig controls.
A few negative sentiment posts in the forum reflect concerns about migration timing and multisig configuration details.

evidence.quote: The proposal updates the Fantom multisig to add Maxi signers and consolidates control of vested BEETS tokens to the Maxi multisig on Fantom.
Unanimous early and stable support for 'Yes, let's do it' across all voting quartiles and 15 unique voters.
Similar proposals enabled gauges with full support and no negative market or TVL impact, supporting operational changes.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- The voting timeline shows unanimous and stable early support for the 'Yes' option, indicating clear consensus among voters.
- Forum discussion includes both neutral and some negative sentiments but overall aligns with the recommendation to update and consolidate multisig control, showing community understanding.
- Similar past proposals (BIP-606 and BIP-605) with operational changes were successful, with no negative token price or TVL impacts, reinforcing this approach.
- Market impacts during the event window were positive for price and TVL, supporting a favorable outcome.
- The recommendation aligns well with forum sentiment and maximizes long-term organizational security and operational efficiency.
